text: The product that sold the most by quantity is **1" 1/2" PLAIN ELBOW UPVC**. This analysis calculated the total quantity sold for each item to identify the top performers. The chart further illustrates the top 10 products by total quantity sold, making it easy to see which items are most popular based on volume.
code:
import pandas as pd
import plotly.express as px

# Calculate total quantity sold for each product
product_qty = df.groupby('Product Name')['Qty'].sum().reset_index()

# Find the product with the maximum total quantity
most_sold_item = product_qty.loc[product_qty['Qty'].idxmax()]

# Sort for better visualization
product_qty_sorted = product_qty.sort_values(by='Qty', ascending=False)

# Create a bar chart to visualize the top selling items by quantity
fig = px.bar(product_qty_sorted.head(10), # Display top 10 for clarity
             x='Product Name',
             y='Qty',
             title='Top 10 Products by Quantity Sold',
             labels={'Product Name': 'Product', 'Qty': 'Total Quantity Sold'},
             color='Qty',
             color_continuous_scale=px.colors.sequential.Plasma)

fig.update_layout(xaxis_title='Product Name',
                  yaxis_title='Total Quantity Sold',
                  xaxis={'categoryorder':'total descending'})

# Save the chart
fig.write_html('storage\\sessions\\5cebc7bd-7214-4a8f-a627-8c867d3b5dc9\\chart.html')

# Assign the figure object to result
result = fig
